hotspots.label: Insect Exoskeleton
hotspots.fact: Cicadas have a hard outer shell called an exoskeleton that protects their body like armor. As it grows, the insect must shed this shell and grow a new, bigger one!

hotspots.label: Lichen Growth
hotspots.fact: The green, crusty patches are lichens, which are living organisms made of fungi and algae working together. Lichens grow very slowly and can live for hundreds of years!

hotspots.label: Tree Bark
hotspots.fact: The adult cicada emerges from the ground or tree bark, shedding its exoskeleton (exuvia) as it transforms. The gray and brown crumbly surface is tree bark, which protects the living wood inside.

hotspots.label: Metamorphosis
hotspots.fact: This image illustrates the life cycle of a cicada and its relationship with its environment. Cicadas undergo incomplete metamorphosis, molting from nymphs to adults.
